p: The aerial parts of myrtle were collected from Haji Abad, Iran during July/August 2015 and then identified by Dr. Mirtajadini at Department of Botany, Shahid Bahonar University of Kerman, Kerman, Iran. Voucher specimen was prepared (KF 1356) and deposited at the herbarium of the Faculty of Pharmacy, Kerman University of medical sciences, Kerman, Iran. Moreover, MEO was obtained from dried harvested leaves by hydro distillation assay in a Clevenger apparatus ( 18). The oil was dried over anhydrous sodium sulfate and stored in -20 Â°C for future analysis.
